inference:
The area of triangle $ABC$ is $\frac{1}{2}$ of the product of the base and height. The base is 8 cm and the height is the length of the altitude to the base. We can use the Pythagorean Theorem to find the length of the altitude:
$$\begin{align*}
a^2+b^2&=c^2\\
16^2+b^2&=20^2\\
b^2&=20^2-16^2\\
b^2&=400-256\\
b^2&=144\\
b&=12
\end{align*}$$

Therefore, the area of triangle $ABC$ is:
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Area}&=\frac{1}{2}\times \text{base}\times\text{height}\\
&=\frac{1}{2}\times8\times12\\
&=\boxed{48}
\end{align*}$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{48}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: The area of a triangle is $\frac{1}{2}(\text{base})(\text{height})$, so the area of triangle $ABC$ is $\frac{1}{2}(8\text{ cm})(\text{10 cm})=\boxed{40}$ square centimeters.
